verses.name: Job 41:13
verses.text: Who can discover the face of his garment? or who can come to him with his double bridle?

verses.name: Job 41:14
verses.text: Who can open the doors of his face? his teeth are terrible round about.

verses.name: Job 41:15
verses.text: His scales are his pride, shut up together as with a close seal.

verses.name: Job 41:16
verses.text: One is so near to another, that no air can come between them.

verses.name: Job 41:17
verses.text: They are joined one to another, they stick together, that they cannot be sundered.

verses.name: Job 41:18
verses.text: By his neesings a light doth shine, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.
